author: jih2nn
content: Here is an update of a naive interop! https://x.com/jih2nn/status/1882004899782902145

author: jih2nn
content:
Also, a PR to Prysm is opened, please take a look when you have some time cc <@363800010518822915> 

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/14819

author: jih2nn
content: Besides the PR, one thing I want to mention is Prysm's .runLateBlockTasks seems to be flaky even when `seconds_per_slot` is 6 seconds. This makes test iteration longer as Fulu fork turns on from epoch 2, which is equivalent to 6.4 minutes. Any idea on this?

author: terencechain
content: Nice fix. I hope you dont mind I just squash the PR into mine

author: terencechain
content: <@845691100072509460> could you write down what is tested so far? Example the methods and the cases. i'll think about more cases today

author: terencechain
content:
In particular do we know if this is true:
- If there's a transaction in the the IL as I retrieve it via GetInclusionList, could the transaction be in the GetPayload or not?

author: jih2nn
content: Not at all, having one commit makes git history cleaner.

author: jih2nn
content: I think it would be great if we could have a sort of test spec. This is what we lack of at the moment, if I'm not wrong, and it would be great help for other client teams to catch up.

author: jih2nn
content: I'm thinking about using assertoor. Once we list up test cases, let me try out assertoor.

author: jih2nn
content: I think yes and no. If the IL transaction is propagated to a builder and the builder includes it in the payload, it's yes. No otherwise.

author: nflaig
content:
<@363800010518822915> from your notes
> Get: Returns all inclusion list transactions for a slot, excluding duplicates.
How do you deduplicate those? transactions are just opaque bytes for us on the CL side. Just byte comparsion?

author: terencechain
content: Oh I was just asking in your geth implemention, do you remove the txs after get payload call? Or do you reuse them for get inclusion lists as well

author: terencechain
content:
I've written down the meta test cases here: https://hackmd.io/@ttsao/focil-interop-test-cases
Anything missing?
